climbs.name: Frog Legs Left
climbs.fa: Liam Wynn & Kobe Daludado(Split FA) Feb 2020

content.description: Starts as per Frog Legs, but gain the sloper with your right hand, use the low left crimp and high feet to gain the arete on the left side of the boulder.

Fun warm up problem, sit start and get a left heel to gain the slopey arete, move right to a good hold on the face, then follow the arete up to the apex of the boulder and mantle. Named after the dinosaur-head-shaped boulder and the fact that the mantle makes you twerk.
content.location: From the trail leading to the butcher area, travel south around behind the butcher boulder, this boulder is obvious due to it's dinosaur-head-like shape and lack of surrounding rocks.

content.description: Start on the jugs on the lowest obvious rail, move left to a sloper and establish a drop knee to gain a right xeno-crimp. Continue right to a crimp rail, gain the arete and mantle. Lowest available foot is off(broken off from main boulder), feet generally start high left.
content.location: North-eastern corner of Butcher boulder, starts tucked below the flakes.

content.description: Start left on the lowest flake of the large boulder. Follow the jugs and good feet right to a big jug, then make a big move to the arete and mantle. Fun!
content.location: Right off the trail, north of the campsite approx 800ft. Obvious boulder with chopped up flakes.

content.description: Start as per Butcher Traverse, but instead of going up to the arete from the big jug, continue right along a crack and mantle 6 feet right of butcher dyno.

Starts below Butcher Direct on the lowest obvious jug on the flake, high feet and leap blindly for the arete without using any intermediates, mantle. Very fun! Easier than it looks but have a good pad setup.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: On the North-west corner of the butcher boulder. Right off the trail.

content.description: Start on the north-west corner on the big jug, then move up with good feet to gain the arete and mantle. This climb is the finish to Butcher Traverse.
content.location: North-west corner of butcher boulder, starts at the big obvious jug.
